data.title: Gannon Athletics had 283 PSAC Scholar
data.meta_description: Gannon had 283 PSAC Scholar-Athletes in 2023-24, ranking third in the conference for percentage of student-athletes to achieve the honors.
data.text:
Football 7/1/2024 2:31:00 PM Jeff Kirik, Assistant Athletic Director for Media Relations

Gannon Athletics had 283 PSAC Scholar-Athletes, including 3rd-highest percentage

Golden Knights ranked third in PSAC in 2023-24 with 59 percent of athletes named Scholar-Athletes

LOCK HAVEN, Pa. – Gannon University finished with the third-highest percentage of PSAC Scholar-Athletes among the conference's 18 universities in 2023-24.

The Golden Knights had 283 Scholar-Athletes out of 479 student-athletes who competed in PSAC play in 2023-24. That meant 59 percent of Gannon's PSAC student-athletes were Scholar-Athletes during the academic/athletic year. GU trailed only Mercyhurst's 67 percent and East Stroudsburg's 60 percent.

To qualify as a PSAC Scholar-Athlete, student-athletes must maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 3.25 upon completion of the academic year. The PSAC finished with 4,037 Scholar-Athletes in 2023-24.

Gannon had the sixth-highest total of Scholar-Athletes in the conference, trailing Bloomsburg (307), Mercyhurst (305), East Stroudsburg (296), Seton Hill (292), and Slippery Rock (285). Among Gannon's women athletes, 148 of 184 (80.4 percent) were Scholar-Athletes, and among GU's men, 135 of 295 (45.7 percent) were Scholar-Athletes.

Gannon's totals do not include student-athletes from sports that do not compete in PSAC play. Acrobatics & tumbling, competitive cheer and dance, women's wrestling and both water polo teams do not compete in the conference.

The women's soccer team led all Gannon teams with 34 Scholar-Athletes, while the baseball team led all men's programs with 32.
